post.body: I've tried SpliTweet & it's not bad. I'll have to give BrightKit a try. Would love 2 hear your feedback after you've tried it.
No thank you!! lol :-)
I was just reading about BrightKit. Have you tried it yet?
I can completely relate. I'm debating between coffee and bed. The problem is I want coffee to win. :-)
Inspiring cause... Thanks for sharing!
You're not the only one.
Great post today on, "Why bear markets make me less likely to invest in your startup."
"Good ideas are plentiful.Good processes are not." ... Well said!
I thought it was... "save for later." :-)
Not yet, but thanks for the reminder. :-)
I agree! I may have to try it this Christmas.
Great article! Thanks for sharing.
No problem... Glad to be back! :-)
I like the new design on your blog. Looks Great! http://bit.ly/3uMMg
I didn't recognize you with the Santa hat. :-)
I'll think about you guys tonight while I'm sitting in front of my fireplace. :-)
Sounds incredible! Your making me hungry.
Should I have used "interesting information?" :-)
I wish there was a way to delete all starred items at once. I was hoping to see that in the update, guess not.
Not at all! It just means you haven't been privy to the finest wines around. :-)
With cheap wine you don't need a corkscrew. It's twist and chug.
What a sad image.
I just said the same thing as I was about to send someone a reply.
Great looking Christmas photo!
I'm enjoying every moment after another weekend with more family camping out at the house.
I forgot about This American Life. I'm usually not listening to the radio though at that time.
I feel the same here. I don't even listen on the weekends.
Oh the joy of making coffee in stealth mode. :-)
They're a happy bunch!!
That's different. It's the random followers that have no profile and are following 1311 people with 56 following them back.
I completely agree. I usually don't follow people that don't have a brief bio and profile picture.
Sweet!! Can't wait to see it in action.
PC?? :-) I have no room to talk. I have a PC laptop on my left and a Mac on the right.
Are they hooked up to your MBP?
Nope! You're not getting old until you can't sleep past 6am.
Recently I've been using bit.ly.
Anytime! Its been one of those days that I've been on a mission.
Absolutely! However, it will be years before we see anything like that here. It's fun to think, "what if?"
That would be awesome! A light rail system has to be a part of Louisville's future.
Taking family on biz trips doesn't work either. They sleep and you still drive. There goes the idea of working while they drive
Exactly!
Happy Birthday... Cheers!!
I feel the same way. Without permission it's nothing else but content theft.
@jaygarmon @earwood If that's our choice of travel arrangements, we better leave now, it could take a while to get there. :)
I'm in... Sounds like a great idea!
That's the plan. I have about 4 or 5 I wouldn't mind dropping in on.
That's not good. If you get good service you should always tip well.
@defrag looks very interesting.
I completely agree. Profile photos are just as important to me as the profile.
That's good. Black ice is nasty! I can drive in snow all day, but ice is something I'm afraid of.
Sorry to hear about your accident this morning. How are you doing this evening?
No, Happy Birthday to you!! Enjoy your special day!!
I thought I was the one with the issue as well. Good to hear I'm not the only one.
I had the same issue today.
Thanks Erin!!
Thanks Amber!!
Thanks Ben!
Thanks!!
That's the greatest thing about the holidays, the traditions and the memories.
Any idea of its ETA?
Hands free Twitter sounds awesome. Is it currently available?
Great list positive traits of exceptional Twitter followers.
Great list!!
asks, "Is The Future Of Advertising Public Relations?" http://bit.ly/17yqP
In Louisville, enjoying the single digit tempatures.
Well said!!
Glad to see that you survived! Happy Birthday!!
Not sure if you'll go blind, but it does sound like a pretty tasty combination. :-)
Little early! ;-)
What's frustrating is when they become nothing more then a sales letter.
Weekly or monthly is fine as long as there's useful information.
Thanks for the compliment!
"Not everyone is going to like you, not everyone is going to have your back." Tommy Tuberville (former Auburn football coach)

Palmisano is positioning IBM for an infrastructure overhaul. http://ff.im/cdf4
RT: @ducttape Social media is a tool, it's not a religion - there are no real rules and everyone is learning on the job.

One thing that is great about working from the home office is taking your lunch and making a big pot of ham and bean soup for dinner.
The unfundable world-changing startup. http://tinyurl.com/5o428c Great read from @scobleizer
RT @bdthomas: ATTN: Louisville --"East End Ad Hoc Lunch Tweet Meet" today; 11:45a @ Qdoba on Shelbyville/Hurstborne. RT this message.

Good morning Twitter peoples!! Even though it's Friday, it's still another busy day.

Why do I continue to watch U of L football?

RT: @ecevents before u think about building communities for your customers, make sure you start with your own staff...eat your own dog food.
Good morning! Up early... built a fire, finished my domestic duties, now I'm sitting down with a cup of tea before more work and projects.

RT: @Scobleizer @tweetdeck new pre-release of TweetDeck has been released.
Enjoying the solitude of an empty house.

Sitting in my kitchen drinking hot chocolate and watching it snow outside.
Reading: @carsonified "Employees, Freelancers and Entrepreneurs - How to recession-proof yourself." http://bit.ly/rdBE

Finally sitting down after cleaning out the garage and putting out Christmas decorations. Now for a few indoor projects.

Automated customer service is brutal! Push 6 buttons, type in your phone, zip etc., verify your account, & then a rep. may be able to help.

Louisville traffic is brutal when it rains.
Good morning friends! It's going to be interesting day. New gig, freezing rain in the afternoon, snow in the evening. What about you?

Holiday traditions are all around this morning as the Queen and the little princesses are finishing off the holiday decorations.
Being the father of a daughter means you spend your Saturday at dance invitationals.
Reading: How Bernie Madoff Made Smart Folks Look Dumb http://bit.ly/Qtuw
Who said Saturday's were suppose to be about relaxing? It appears as if I've received my orders for the day and it's titled, "Go, Go, Go!"

Engaged in my Sunday morning routine. Tea, NYTimes, and little holiday jazz in the background.
